trans-unit.source: Step 2: Generate the Schema for the Flat-file Message
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Generate the Schema for the Flat-file Message

trans-unit.source: As described in the business scenario, Fabrikam sends a flat file message to Contoso.
trans-unit.target: As described in the business scenario, Fabrikam sends a flat file message to Contoso.

trans-unit.source: For Contoso, to process the message using the <token>bridge</token>, it must have the schema of the flat-file message added to the <token>af_integration</token> solution.
trans-unit.target: For Contoso, to process the message using the <token>bridge</token>, it must have the schema of the flat-file message added to the <token>af_integration</token> solution.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> SDK provides a <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> that generates a flat-file schema using an existing flat-file instance message.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> SDK provides a <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> that generates a flat-file schema using an existing flat-file instance message.

trans-unit.source: Contoso uses the flat-file message instance message that it received from Fabrikam (out of band, over e-mail or through another medium) and then uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> to create the schema.
trans-unit.target: Contoso uses the flat-file message instance message that it received from Fabrikam (out of band, over e-mail or through another medium) and then uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> to create the schema.

trans-unit.source: To use the wizard, see <link xlink:href="33b5de1f-1e4f-4f98-a39e-c2ebaeb23d1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard</link>.
trans-unit.target: To use the wizard, see <link xlink:href="33b5de1f-1e4f-4f98-a39e-c2ebaeb23d1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Use the Flat File Schema Wizard</link>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, let us assume that a flat-file message (<embeddedLabel>ORDERS.txt</embeddedLabel>) is sent to Contoso.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, let us assume that a flat-file message (<embeddedLabel>ORDERS.txt</embeddedLabel>) is sent to Contoso.

trans-unit.source: Contoso uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> and generates the <embeddedLabel>PO.xsd</embeddedLabel> flat-file message schema.
trans-unit.target: Contoso uses the <embeddedLabel>Flat File Schema Wizard</embeddedLabel> and generates the <embeddedLabel>PO.xsd</embeddedLabel> flat-file message schema.

trans-unit.source: Both the instance message and the message schema are in the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247973</linkUri></externalLink> sample.
trans-unit.target: Both the instance message and the message schema are in the <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=247973</linkUri></externalLink> sample.

trans-unit.source: Add the PO.xsd schema to the <token>af_integration</token> project you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Add the PO.xsd schema to the <token>af_integration</token> project you created earlier.
